meanings.definition: The redness and irritation of the skin caused by exposure to wind.
meanings.sent1: After skiing all day, my cheeks had painful windburns.
meanings.sent2: She applied a soothing cream to her windburns after a long hike.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon looked funny with its little windburns after sticking its head out of the car window.
meanings.sent4: His anger was like a fierce wind, leaving emotional windburns on everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The windburns on her face were as bright as a ripe tomato.

meanings.sent1: I forgot my scarf, so I windburned badly on the walk home.
meanings.sent2: He always windburns easily when he forgets to wear a hat in cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The poor scarecrow windburns every day standing in the open field.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words windburned his heart, leaving him feeling raw and exposed.
meanings.sent5: The desert sun can quickly windburn those who are not careful.

meanings.sent1: His constant exposure to the elements led to frequent windburns.
meanings.sent2: The children's playful antics often result in unintentional windburns.
meanings.sent3: The windburns on his nose made him look like a comical clown.
meanings.sent4: The journey through life can leave us with emotional windburns that take time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter wind left a trail of windburns on the exposed skin of the hikers.
